Class Table

java.lang.Object
main.Table
public class Table extends Object
Represents a table object that contains a collection of columns.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Table(String name)
    Constructs a new Table with the specified name.

  • Constructor Details

    • Table

      public Table(String name)
      Constructs a new Table with the specified name.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the table.

  • Method Details

    • addColumn

      public void addColumn(Column column)
      Adds a new column to the table. The column is assigned a unique name, initialized with a default value, and configured to allow blank values. If the table already contains columns with cells, the new column is populated with the same number of cells, each initialized with the default value.

      Throws: - Exception: If any part of column creation or manipulation fails.

    • newColumn

      public Column newColumn()

    • renameColumn

      public void renameColumn(String name, String newName)
      Renames an existing column in the table.
      Parameters:
      name - The current name of the column to be renamed.
      newName - The new name to be assigned to the column. It must be non-null and unique among all column names in the table.

    • changeColumn

      public void changeColumn(String name, Column newColumn)
      Replaces an existing column in the table with a new column.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the column to be replaced. It must match the name of an existing column in the table.
      newColumn - The new column to replace the existing one. It must be compatible with the table structure.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if no column with the specified name is found.

    • addRow

      public void addRow()
      Adds a new row to the table by appending a new cell with the default value to each column.

    • insertRow

      public void insertRow(int index)
      Inserts a new row at the specified index by adding a cell to each column in the table at the given position.
      Parameters:
      index - The zero-based index at which the new row should be inserted. Must be within the valid range of row indices in the table.

    • addRow

      public void addRow(List<String> row)
      Adds a new row to the table using the specified list of values. The number of values in the provided list must match the number of columns in the table. If the sizes do not match, the row is not added.
      Parameters:
      row - A list of strings representing the values for the new row.

    • updateRow

      public void updateRow(int index, List<String> row)
      Updates the values of a specific row in the table at the specified index. The row values provided must match the size of the table's columns. If the size of the provided row values does not match the number of columns, the method will return without making any changes.
      Parameters:
      index - The zero-based index of the row to update. Must be within the valid range of row indices in the table.
      row - A list of strings representing the new values to update the row with.

    • getRow

      public List<String> getRow(int index)
      Retrieves a row of data from the table at the specified index.
      Parameters:
      index - The zero-based index of the row to retrieve. Must be within the valid range of row indices.
      Returns:
      A list of strings representing the values of the row at the specified index.

    • removeRow

      public void removeRow(int rowIndx)
      Removes a row from all columns in the table at the specified index.
      Parameters:
      rowIndx - The index of the row to be removed. It should be within the valid bounds of the row indices in the table.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Retrieves the name of the table.
      Returns:
      The name of the table as a string.

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Sets the name of the table to the specified value.
      Parameters:
      name - The new name to be assigned to the table. It must be a non-null string.

    • getColumnsInfo

      public List<String> getColumnsInfo()
      Retrieves information about all columns in the table.
      Returns:
      A list of strings: column's name, type, whether it allows blank values, and the default value.

    • getColumnNames

      public List<String> getColumnNames()
      Returns:
      A list of all column names.

    • removeColumn

      public void removeColumn(String colName)
      Removes a column from the table based on the specified column name.
      Parameters:
      colName - The name of the column to be removed. It must match the name of an existing column in the table.

    • getColumns

      public List<List<String>> getColumns()
      Retrieves the data of all columns in the table.
      Returns:
      A list of lists, where each inner list represents the data of a single column in the table.

    • updateCell

      public void updateCell(String nameColumn, Integer rowIndex, String value)
      Updates the cell value in the specified column and row within the table.
      Parameters:
      nameColumn - The name of the column containing the cell to update. Must correspond to an existing column in the table.
      rowIndex - The zero-based index of the row containing the cell to update. Must be within the valid range of row indices for the column.
      value - The new value to set in the specified cell. Must be compatible with the column's data type.

    • getCell

      public String getCell(String nameColumn, Integer rowIndex)
      Retrieves the value of a specific cell in the table.
      Parameters:
      nameColumn - The name of the column containing the desired cell. Must correspond to an existing column in the table.
      rowIndex - The zero-based index of the row containing the desired cell. Must be within the valid range of row indices for the column.
      Returns:
      The value of the specified cell as a string.

    • changeAllowBlanks

      public void changeAllowBlanks(String columnName)
      Toggles the allowance of blank (null or empty) values for the specified column in the table.
      Parameters:
      columnName - The name of the column whose "allow blanks" setting is to be changed. Must correspond to an existing column in the table.

    • changeType

      public void changeType(String columnName)
      Changes the type of the specified column in the table, cycling between String, Boolean, and Integer types. If the current type of the column is String, it changes to Boolean. If the current type is Boolean, it changes to Integer. If the current type is Integer, it changes to String.
      Parameters:
      columnName - The name of the column whose type is to be changed. The column must exist in the table.

    • getDefaultValue

      public String getDefaultValue(String column)
      Retrieves the default value for a specified column in the table.
      Parameters:
      column - The name of the column for which to retrieve the default value. Must correspond to a valid column name in the table.
      Returns:
      The default value of the specified column as an Object.

    • findColumn

      public Column findColumn(String columnName)
      Retrieves a column from the table based on the specified column name.
      Parameters:
      columnName - The name of the column to find. Must correspond to an existing column in the table.
      Returns:
      The column with the specified name, or null if no column with the given name exists.

    • getClass

      public String getClass(String column)
      Retrieves the data type class of a specified column in the table.
      Parameters:
      column - The name of the column whose data type is to be retrieved. Must correspond to an existing column in the table.
      Returns:
      The Class object representing the data type of the specified column.

    • setDefaultValue

      public void setDefaultValue(String column, String value)
      Sets the default value for a specified column in the table. The column must exist in the table, and the value must be compatible with the column's data type.
      Parameters:
      column - The name of the column for which to set the default value. It must correspond to an existing column in the table.
      value - The new default value to be assigned to the column. It must match the column's data type.

    • getId

      public UUID getId()

    • getData

      public HashMap<String,List<String>> getData()

    • getNumberOfRows

      public int getNumberOfRows()
